conclusion: Analyze the circuit in two scenarios: switch open and switch closed using Ohm's Law and electric power formula.
When the switch is open, the circuit consists of resistor R1 and ammeter with current I0 = 0.5 A.
Voltage U across the circuit when switch is open is 10 V using Ohm's Law.
When the switch is closed, electric motor with internal resistance R2 is added to the circuit.
Total resistance in the circuit when switch is closed is 30 Î©.
Current I when switch is closed is 1/3 A using Ohm's Law.
Electric power P consumed by the circuit when switch is closed is 10/3 W.
Calculated power P = 10/3 W is compared with 15 W and found to be less.
Electric power P consumed by the circuit is less than 15 W.
